page.title: 03SOME INTERESTING HEDGES
page.content: There is a house in Farnley which is very interesting. The hedges have been cut into different shapes. There are two trains, a boat and a few little houses. The hedges have been there for 50 or 60 years. The present owner says that they were all there when he moved into the house. It was quite a shock when he first saw them. Four people had looked after them before him. He cuts the hedges with electric shears and it takes him three to four hours. He cuts them about every two weeks from May to October but they do not need cutting in winter. Nobody helps him trim the hedges, especially not the children because the shears are dangerous for them. He likes the hedges very much but they are a bit of hard work.
